paper_abstract: The Randic index of an organic molecule whose molecular graph is G is the slim of the weights (d(u)d(v))(-1/2) of all edges uv of G, where d(u) denotes the degree of the vertex u of the molecular graph G. In this paper, we investigate some minimal Randic index properties and give the tree with the third minimal Randic index among the trees with n vertices and k pendant vertices.
paper_title: The third minimal Randic index tree with k pendant vertices
